title: Fan, 1760–80
medium: Medium: goauche on parchment, paper backing (mount); painted ivory (sticks)
description: Pleated cabriolet fan with the obverse showing an upper mount with naval scenes while the lower mount has sailors in rowboats. Both mounts have floral borders. The reverse has an upper mount of a girl seated in front of a landscape scene; the lower mount shows a house and fence. The sticks are carved openwork (à jour) with painting and gilding and have Chinoiserie figures. Paste jewel set in both ends of the pin.

tombstone.epitaph:
Fan, 1760–80.
1760–80. Medium: goauche on parchment, paper backing (mount); painted ivory (sticks). Bequest of Sarah Cooper Hewitt. 1931-6-114.
